Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.gui

Class GodCardsPopup

java.lang.Object
javafx.stage.Window
javafx.stage.Stage
it.polimi.ingsw.client.gui.GodCardsPopup
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.event.EventTarget
public class GodCardsPopup
extends javafx.stage.Stage
This class is a Stage which shows the cards contained in godCardsDescriptions keyValues(), used for setup purpose, to choose match/player cards, and during the match to show matchGodCards powers. In the latter case, it's important for the stage to be unique, so a singleton pattern is used.

  • Property Summary

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Modifier Constructor Description
    private GodCardsPopup​(javafx.stage.Stage ownerStage, int maxSelections, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> godCardsDescriptions, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.stage.WindowEvent> handler)
    The scene is composed by a VBox with: a labelVBox with different labels depending on maxSelection and so on the state of the match, a tilePane with the cards, a bottom anchor pane with a space to show errors and eventually a submit button

    Adds a Text which'll show error messages

    protected int getSelectionsNum()
    Returns the number of selections, useful to know when the choice is completed
    protected javafx.scene.control.Button getSubmit()
    Method which returns the submit button.
    private void initializeImages​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> godCardsDescriptions)
    This private method creates the imageViews and adds them to the tilePane, setting also the eventHandler for MouseClicked event depending on the number of cards already selected (a card can be so selected, deselected or ignored) The descriptions are shown as tooltips installed on the imageViews.
    protected boolean isPresentOnBottom​(javafx.scene.Node node)
    Lets you know if a node is present in the bottom pane
    protected void resetPopup()
    Resets the first instance giving the possibility to create a new, different godCardsPopup in the phase of setup

  • Constructor Details

    • GodCardsPopup

      private GodCardsPopup​(javafx.stage.Stage ownerStage, int maxSelections, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> godCardsDescriptions, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.stage.WindowEvent> handler)
      The scene is composed by a VBox with: a labelVBox with different labels depending on maxSelection and so on the state of the match, a tilePane with the cards, a bottom anchor pane with a space to show errors and eventually a submit button
      Parameters:
      ownerStage - the Stage on which the popup'll appear
      maxSelections - maximum number of cards that can be selected
      godCardsDescriptions - map of cards and descriptions that have to be showed
      handler - to set the close request handler based on the state of the game

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static GodCardsPopup getInstance​(javafx.stage.Stage ownerStage, int maxSelections, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> godCardsDescriptions, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.stage.WindowEvent> handler)
      This public method returns the unique instance of godCardsPopup if already created, otherwise creates it.

    • getSelectionsNum

      protected int getSelectionsNum()
      Returns the number of selections, useful to know when the choice is completed
      Returns:
      the number of cards selected from the user

    • getChosenGodCards

      protected java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getChosenGodCards()
      Returns:
      set of chosenGodCards, selected from the user

    • addErrorMessage

      protected void addErrorMessage​(javafx.scene.text.Text node)
      Adds a Text which'll show error messages
      Parameters:
      node - text node

    • isPresentOnBottom

      protected boolean isPresentOnBottom​(javafx.scene.Node node)
      Lets you know if a node is present in the bottom pane
      Parameters:
      node - node to search for
      Returns:
      true if the node is present in the bottomPane (AnchorPane) of the stage

    • getSubmit

      protected javafx.scene.control.Button getSubmit()
      Method which returns the submit button. Can be used, for example, to set the handler of an event from outside the class.
      Returns:
      the submit button of the stage

    • resetPopup

      protected void resetPopup()
      Resets the first instance giving the possibility to create a new, different godCardsPopup in the phase of setup

    • initializeImages

      private void initializeImages​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> godCardsDescriptions)
      This private method creates the imageViews and adds them to the tilePane, setting also the eventHandler for MouseClicked event depending on the number of cards already selected (a card can be so selected, deselected or ignored) The descriptions are shown as tooltips installed on the imageViews.
      Parameters:
      godCardsDescriptions - map of godCards names and descriptions to be shown
